meanings.sent1: The lost puppy stravages around the park, looking for its owner.
meanings.sent2: On weekends, I enjoy stravaging through the forest to explore nature.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat stravages through the house, investigating every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts stravaged from one idea to another, unable to focus.
meanings.sent5: The old man would often stravage along the beach, reminiscing about his youth.

meanings.sent1: She stravages to finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: Athletes must stravage to improve their skills and reach their goals.
meanings.sent3: The little ant stravages to carry a large crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, we must stravage like warriors to overcome challenges.
meanings.sent5: The determined student stravages to understand complex math problems.

meanings.definition: A state of disorder or chaos.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the room was left in complete stravages.
meanings.sent2: The battlefield was a scene of stravages after the fierce battle.
meanings.sent3: The kitchen turned into stravages when the kids attempted to bake cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was in stravages, unable to focus on any one task.
meanings.sent5: The storm left a trail of stravages in its wake, with debris scattered everywhere.
